website_summaries.verdict: The VSX-LX303 is a great middle-of-the-road Pioneer amplifier. It’s got plenty of power, supports 4K HDR, and works with Sonos speakers.
pros: Supports up to 3 zones of audio at once, so you can play different music in different rooms
Has features found on pricier models (like built-in Chromecast functionality) at a lower cost
cons: It’s got 200W, which is enough for a medium-size room but not for a proper home theater
It doesn’t support Dolby Vision pass-through

customer_reviews.title: My brand new unit is defective
customer_reviews.text: I received my unit and when I installed it it is not working. I sent it to an authorized Pioneer service center here in Manila and they said that the Digital Signal Processor is defective. I know it's passed the 30 day return policy. But I am from Manila Philippines. Help me out guys.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo Umali

customer_reviews.title: AMP DIAG mode
customer_reviews.text: I have had this receiver about 2 months. The first 6 weeks this receiver performed as it should. The last 2 weeks it started tripping the breaker my outlets were on. I did not know what was doing this at first until the unit trip the breaker then was stuck in "AMP DIAG" mode. I will be shipping this to a repair center now. FYI - I was not mis matching speakers or cranking up the volume to overdrive the receiver. Just watching TV.
customer_reviews.author: Chester Curry

customer_reviews.title: Really nice receiver that is 4K & Dolby Atmos compatible
customer_reviews.text: I decided to upgrade to Dolby Atmos. Pioneer is a solid brand for home theater. Even though the manual states it was designed for 8 Ohm speakers, the on-screen software only allows 6 Ohm and 4 Ohm as a choice in setup.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: I'm blown away! 😂😆😭
customer_reviews.text: This has upgraded the "surround sound" in our living room to a 360-degree, total immersion, quality audio experience. "Is it raining outside or did that sound come off of the back or ceiling speakers?" How cool is that ☔️ effect?! We used YouTube collection of Atmos sound to gauge or try the new, elevated experience after installation. Especially if matched with Bose Home system speakers and subwoofer (+ 4K tv)... the sound emitted by this Pioneer ELITE VSX-LX 303 is absolutely AMAZING. It's a whole new paradigm of home cinematic experience... this will make me ditch the movie theaters more, lol.
customer_reviews.author: Metavisioninc

customer_reviews.title: Great Receiver!
customer_reviews.text: We love that all our electronics (T.V., Turntable, CD, DVD, FM, etc.) are all running through the receiver and the sound quality is superior to what we had before! However it was not easy for an electronics novice like me to setup...I down loaded and printed nearly 130 pages of owners manual, waded through the pages and ended up hiring a Geek Guy to come and set it up for me! It would be helpful if there were clear, concise, sequential, with visual support, instructions for easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good value, tons of options, high power.  I had some issues using zone 2 and 3.
customer_reviews.text: I use this with chromecast. Telling a google home mini to play a song or video makes the tv turn on, play the music or youtube video. The amplifier turns on automatically, and plays through the speakers throughout the home via a Monoprice 8-Channel Speaker Selector. Telling the home mini to turn off the tv stops the music or video, turns off the tv, turns off the amplifier. Changing the volume on the tv changes the amplifier volume. I tried to use multiple zones from the amplifier, but was running into issues where the audio wasn't playing on zone 2 and 3. I just went back to the speaker selector.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Good Reciever bad Amazon
customer_reviews.text: The receiver works fine but I am unhappy about paying for a Prime membership with two day shipping only to find out Amazon decides what is deemed to be a necessity and what is not. I waited a month for shipping but they have no problem selling their own branded products (Firestick) which apparently is a necessity Maybe Walmart is a better option
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Stopped working after one month!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 30 days, then the hdmi signal started dropping out and the signal randomly disconnects. Picture turns blue and signal has to reset. Now the video shuts off with any volume adjustment (or randomly). I’ve troubleshot the hdmi handshake issue to death. Practically is unusable and since it failed shortly after the 30 day window I’m stuck with a very expensive paperweight (and still have to buy another receiver). EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED. My last pioneer receiver worked for 25 years without issue. New stuff is apparently junk.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: DON'T waste young time!
customer_reviews.text: As Angelo and I'm sure others I'm sure has stated this thing is DEFECTIVE! Had picture with NO SOUND! I didn't know Onkyo bought Pioneer some year's ago and Pioneer is on the bottom of the list has far as Receiver's for this group.Also in this group is the Interga the premium brand for Onkyo which I purchased after the Pioneer debacle. I very pleased with the Interga and if I were you stay FAR away from Pioneer Receivers. Onkyo is just using the name.The good old days of Pioneer are OVER!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LX303 very close to perfect
customer_reviews.text: Receiver sounds great, running 5.2.4. Speakers are 4ohm and this receiver has no problems driving them. Plenty of HDMI's and ARC that actually works. Remote is okay, corners are to sharp. I'm used to the display telling me if it's stereo/surround/atmos or dts-x. If you want to see if it is DTS-X or Dolby Atmos it's a tiny little light on the display. Whenever I turn it off it defaults back to TV and sometimes when its already on it goes to TV. The big display tells you which input......my old Pioneers told you what what sound output was which was nice. other than that decent receiver.
customer_reviews.author: SteveD

customer_reviews.title: Really great for the money
customer_reviews.text: The setup for this receiver was easy and really balanced the pioneer Andrew Jones set up. I was blown away by its performance in all areas,using a 5.2.4 Dolby atmos arrangement.
customer_reviews.author: shawn h.

customer_reviews.title: How can they sell this for so little?
customer_reviews.text: This sucker blows the socks off any other receiver I've ever owned (and I've owned a LOT of home theater receivers from names like Denon, Yamaha, Pioneer, Panasonic and Onkyo). The user interface and setup wizard are awesome, and once calibrated, the Atmos experience is as good or better than at the IMAX. A big shout out to Larry at Huppins (the seller), who shipped out a replacement calibration mic IMMEDIATELY once I mentioned that the one Panasonic shipped with the receiver wasn't being recognized by the setup wizard. I will TOTALLY do business with them in the future (and I see why they have a 5 star rating)!
customer_reviews.author: John Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Not able to  fix my issue
customer_reviews.text: When you make a purchase such as this you want it to work. After making an exchange I still experienced the same problem in the hdmi ports for the bluray and the firestick. I got an audio signal but no video. If I did get video, after a few minutes I would lose it.
customer_reviews.author: Guess?

customer_reviews.title: Replaced a newer reciever with this
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an Onkyo TX-NR696 and ended up returning it for this. Even though the Onkyo had THX Select, the Pioneer has more channels, a better app, and menu set-up. It's funny, because they're both owned by the same company. The sound quality is better, possibly thanks to the sound processing and power output. I also like that you can adjust individual speaker levels in-app. This is PERFECT for testing speakers, and when I need to focus sound at night without waking the family.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P.

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away
customer_reviews.text: Defective on arrival. Can't get the unit out of the boot loop/ self diagnostics loops. NG: LCRSLSR NG: 1L1R2L2R I'm out hundreds of dollars. Don't buy pioneer or Onkyo!
customer_reviews.author: Clee Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Power is not what I expected. While sufficient for our room, volume needs to be pushed to get true theater levels. However, in all other areas it is top notch. 9.1 configurable any way you want. Those who are complaining are not reading the manual. Picture quality is excellent. Just replacing your older non 4K with this one will improve your HD 1080p pic without any processing. Better circuitry is to be commended for that.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Amazing receiver, incredible price point and features
customer_reviews.text: I mean, what can I say? 9.2 channel sound for less than $500? That alone is something. But on top of that, it’s clear quality sound on every channel. It’s versatile, supporting everything from 5.1 to 5.1.4 to 7.2.2. It provides full 4K Dolby Vision and HDR support. It supports Atmos and DTS, which was the main thing I was going for with a 7.1.2 setup - I wanted object based sound. It controls attached devices to save power, can connect to the internet and your phone in multiple ways and has 2 HDMI outs and 7 in. It comes with the calibration mic and calibration is a piece of cake. It’s an amazing receiver for less than $500.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dono

customer_reviews.title: This is why my av receiver was on sale.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for 2 weeks then hdmi ARC fails to turn on and off tv.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Smith

customer_reviews.title: HDMI Standby Pass-through does not work.
customer_reviews.text: I struggled getting this unit set up and still cannot get the TV signal from my cable box to automatically pass through the receiver (while it is turned off) to my TV unless the receiver is/was set to Cab/Sat. I've tried every combination of settings. I finally called Pioneer and after a long conversation with the "technician", I was finally able to get her to understand the issue. Her response was that it is a "communication issue" and there is no resolution. Incredibly glitchy!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Crackel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome upgrade and options.
customer_reviews.text: Love this...I upgraded from a 7.1 sony from 10yrs ago. I upgraded to 4k tv and now sound matches quality. Atmos is great, and for things without atmos sound the dts x helps in getting close to that sound field. Also chromecast and bluetooth are great options I didn't have before.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Nice Receiver
customer_reviews.text: This is the first receiver I've owned. I used to have a HTIAB. For the price it's probably one of the best receivers you can get. I don't need all of these extravagant features so I'm not sure how the more expensive ones compare. The setup was simple. There are a ton of sound options to choose from. It has Dolby Atmos feature (for when I set up in future) and is also a 9.2 set, so there are plenty of speaker expansions. I've had this product a month and am really happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great for movies, not so great for all music
customer_reviews.text: One big bad is you must scroll thru sound fields with one button on remote, takes FOREVER. Betcha that button wears out in one year. Everything else, one month in, is good to great. The auto calibrate with mic does a good job for precise theater sound My TV says picture quality full 4K. So do my eyes. ARC works great and intuitive. Equalizer for each and every channel, times 3 user defined presets. So when I finally get it tweaked just right music may yet be saved. Impressive selection of features that allow a nice variety of ways to adjust signal processing to get exactly (or very close) to the sound you want.
customer_reviews.author: MorePower Tool man

customer_reviews.title: Product was as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up; great price for a receiver with 2nd amplifier capability; using the main zone for home theater, and using zone 2 along with a separate amplifier for music in 4 other areas of the house. Not using zone 3 at this time. Only issue is that in order to use the sleep function, you have to navigate thru several screens to get to the "Power Management" section - there is no "sleep" button on the remote, nor are there any assignable buttons on the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Montrose Tim

customer_reviews.title: Be cautious!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this receiver in February and it stopped working in June. After calling support I was told that I had to pay to ship it back ($75) or drive 5 hours round trip to the nearest service center. I was told that was how their warranty worked. Very disappointed in Pioneer. It is supposed to be a good name brand but only lasted 4 months. Warranty should have covered getting the receiver there as well. I also emailed multiple times with no response. Be sure to read the fine print with the warranty or choose a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: alicia spillers

customer_reviews.title: Solid receiver, superb value
customer_reviews.text: Got this on sale for my 7.1.2 home theater with 4K projector, it has worked flawlessly so far. Excellent value for the money. It is only 1 month in, but has not had any problems with signals from Xbox One X, NVIDIA Shield, or Nintendo Switch. I have not tried any of the native streaming options. It is a little bulky, leave plenty of room in the back for connections.
customer_reviews.author: N. Chumley

customer_reviews.title: Equipment sold was faulty
customer_reviews.text: After the purchase, the equipment has been faulty and I have not been able to put to use since. Obviously, the return time has passed since it was shipped to a country overseas. Please be advised when purchasing this product. The product received was possibly pre-owned and not the brand new product expected.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: Pioneer never disappoints me
customer_reviews.text: Nice product like everything from Pioneer, the sound is amazing if you pair it with the appropriate speakers, I used the Harman Kardon HKTS 16 and sound amazingly perfect deep bass and cristal clearl voice and surround sound for movies and music. I love the smart functionality I mainly use Spotify connect but I tried amazon music and AirPlay 2 all works as it should, zero issues. I’ll update if something changes with the time, for now I’m really satisfied with my new setup :)
customer_reviews.author: MPD

customer_reviews.title: Good value for an Elite receiver
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to set up this receiver with an hdmi connection to your tv. The ability to choose different speaker configurations is really nice and I actually like the Pioneer Remote app's performance and menu better than the icontrol av5 app for my older VSX 1130 receiver. The sound fields sound quite good in my living room, which has a 9 speaker setup including subwoofer. Much will depend on your speakers. Since I have a closed in cabinet, I use and recommend a component cooling fan with either top or rear exhaust ports to keep the receiver cool. The DTS Neural X sound setting is really cool as it can upscale Dolby digital signals to true 3 dimensional surround sound.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: Do Not Buy!!! Wanted new system for newly built home. Bought in January 2020, it was installed in February and had been working great for one month. Turn on 3 days ago and display screen shows Thermal Error. Have tried everything to fix with no solution. Pioneer brand not what it use to be.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Sbrusch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This receiver has been great. We have a 5.4.1 speaker system setup for Dolby Atmos, including four speakers in the ceiling. This puts out some truly impressive sound.
customer_reviews.author: Q-360

customer_reviews.title: Good. Not great. But its 400$. What the heck.
customer_reviews.text: Cool value for money 5.1.4 set up. Been using Yamaha and Onkyo for 20 years. Just not used to it yet. Need to warm up to the sound. Been using it for two weeks now. Watched John Wick, Skyfall and Guardians of the Galaxy. Maybe I've been used to Onkyo which I have been using for almost 10 years. I find it “lacking”.
customer_reviews.author: hotchefnick

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed - POS
customer_reviews.text: HDMI works does not work on the second zone. Zone 1 drops the HDMI connection from comcast and it takes 20 minutes of button pushing to get it to reconnect. I use to trust pioneer but no more. The next pioneer up has a better connection system. I thought I was buying quality but I guess not - - Dont make the same mistake I did - - DO NOT BUY PIONEER PRODUCTS. POS
customer_reviews.author: George Bush

customer_reviews.title: Good Receiver, chromecast/Google home integration lacking
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, great sound! Also, it's supposed to get Google Home integration. Still waiting... "Chromecast built in" is kind of a misnomer. It really only works with certain apps, instead of just casting anything on your phone or PC. And just after 6 months, the digital signal processing unit died! Only get sound out of one channel... Confirmed by very friendly tech support
customer_reviews.author: trilife

customer_reviews.title: Issues with inputs
customer_reviews.text: At first it appears there are a plethora of inputs. It is a bit deceiving because for each type of input (GAME for example) you can only use one method. Only one of HDMI, component, etc. So you cannot take advantage of all the input ports. Another issue for me is the component input only supports 480i. This is a problem because my device doesn't output 480i, but instead 480p, 720p, and 1080i.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver with small glitch (Updated)
customer_reviews.text: There is a software glitch with this receiver when you choose to upscale 1080P to 4K, the picture intermittently blacks out. Turning this off makes it work fine. Also, make sure you have high speed HDMI 2.0 cables, or you will not deliver a 4K picture. Other than that, this is the single best receiver for the money
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: works well with our LG OLED
customer_reviews.text: I'm not putting a picture through this, just using it as an ARC controlled audio for my TV that mostly uses a Firestick. It has worked well, sound quality is good and features are good.
customer_reviews.author: An Avid Niven Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for me!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my 7.2.2 setup and it's very good sounding. Comes with a mic to do a auto-setup and it does a fairly good job. Love the fact that it comes with dual HDMI output. ("Main" HDMI is the only one that support HDR/DolbyVision, if that matters to you like it did for me).
customer_reviews.author: Ronny V.

customer_reviews.title: Great value and performance
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product, which offers great value and versatility. Initial setup is easy, even for a novice. Ongoing adjustments to speaker levels, etc. are very convenient and intuitive. The sound and picture quality is great. This unit replaces an older Pioneer Elite surround receiver which worked flawlessly for 12+ years.
customer_reviews.author: Rexman

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: This has been working great. I do a 4K pass though and have no problem with it. Once in a while it is a bit slow in detecting the sound, so you might have a second with no sound coming out.
customer_reviews.author: 2close2call

customer_reviews.title: POS. Great radio! I bought it for network/ Bluetooth connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Well it won’t connect via blue tooth. To anything. Yes I’ve been in the settings. Yes I did the firmware update. Yes I’ve been on with support. It will not pair and stick. See various devices, sometimes. But never stays connected for more than 30 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa JD

customer_reviews.title: Has network issues when using Google home mine or dose for me which case a few day of big headaches
customer_reviews.text: Had to return the first one ship to me because of a bad network card or that what pioneer said was probably the problem but when I got had same problem found out that our Google home mine is crashing the network card in the receiver why I have no clue being it so post work with Google home assistant
customer_reviews.author: Eric Bates

customer_reviews.title: working great with my klipsch sound system and svs subs
customer_reviews.text: works great plays loud, cant even go past 30 percent volume or police prolly be knockin on door. and stereo and video 4k content hdr. Once you adjust the settings and treble and bass and a custom mcacc tune for your speakers this things will crank the bass to my subs.
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: receiver
customer_reviews.text: makes my home theater system sound lie a movie house because I have the rights speakers to make all work.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory L Stewart

customer_reviews.title: I need to know how set up speaker A&B on the receiver its only showing SP A
customer_reviews.text: I used this AV for my home entertainment sounds effect. This is super receiver that i ever had it delivered the real surround sound effect to my movie.
customer_reviews.author: LADD

customer_reviews.title: Superb AVR by any measure!
customer_reviews.text: Superb value and great performing AVR. If it proves to be reliable long-term it's the best I've ever owned, and have spent way more.
customer_reviews.author: Just My Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Good price for such a greater receiver.
customer_reviews.text: Love this receiver. Sound is awesome and works great with all our home theater speakers. Clear, good bass
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine S.

customer_reviews.title: 5/7 receiver. 2/10 for the app.
customer_reviews.text: Love the receiver, not a huge fan of the app, which unfortunately seems like it should be a great go to for control of all the settings on the receiver but it's not very intuitive. Maybe I just need more time to play with it and figure it out. Overall very happy with the product, 5/7 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Very good receiver
customer_reviews.text: Great HDMI switching and super sound quality. Replaced a high end receiver and this has better features for a much lower price.
customer_reviews.author: Eric T.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound & features
customer_reviews.text: This was a key component of my new home entertainment system. I am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: 911 Fellow

customer_reviews.title: Just okay.
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough overall. However, when you turn it on or switch sources, no sound comes out for a few seconds while you wait for all the relays to stop clicking. It’s not a very “Premier” level of polished product. But it’s also much cheaper than most Premier products.
customer_reviews.author: xtr

customer_reviews.title: Great reciever
customer_reviews.text: This is a great reciever , 9.2 u can do alot with it , powerful receiver with great features
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Sounds
customer_reviews.text: My old receiver had a center rear speaker. With the new it was looking for a pair of speakers. I was able to adjust the sound manually and everything sounds wonderful
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Completely changed how I listen to music and movies.
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t be happier with this amp. Only minor comment is that switching zones on the remote requires a tandem 5 second button press. Adding a few more buttons would make sone changing easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound quality
customer_reviews.text: This thing sounds amazing. Packed with features and makes my speakers sound alive!!
customer_reviews.author: Simon Payne

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for any buck!
customer_reviews.text: Great value on this unit. I bought the big Yamaha RXA 4 months ago and I actually like this Pioneer better. Integrated easily and was a breeze for me not being an AV expert by any means to setup and make adjustments to. Very happy with my purchase and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Ronaldson

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and playing music though Dolby Atmos or DTS-X is absolutely amazing. I'm using Pioneer Atmos enabled speakers for a 5.2.4 system and I couldn't be happier with the full theater experience!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Eric H

customer_reviews.title: Best value 9.2 surround sound reciever
customer_reviews.text: The best value in a 9.2 surround sound reciever a great value good power quality sound great surround sound highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: sean dees

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: This is a great unit, I have it setup for 5.1.2 speakers and works great
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis

customer_reviews.title: Great reciver
customer_reviews.text: Best reciver for its price the sound is amazing and the video quilting is great I would strongly recommend this for any one looking for a great reciver even if your starting with a 7.1 speaker system so much room for upgrades down the road
customer_reviews.author: No one

customer_reviews.title: All you need
customer_reviews.text: This avr replaces an ancient Elite that was having problems after 10 years of service. Glad I upgraded. Much better interface and all the power you need. Likes... took my banana plugs & setup was quick. Phone app lets you dial in speaker levels from the seating position. Lots of sound profiles. Cons... I had to called Pioneer on how to boost sound level so all inputs were syncronized. Great product for the price & it runs much cooler than the competition (Marantz).
customer_reviews.author: Scott W.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sound
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and sounds amazing We have the Bose speakers and Sub-wooder and we needed something with power. This Pioneer is doing a great job.
customer_reviews.author: ami hanan

customer_reviews.title: There is enough power for my 7 speaker system
customer_reviews.text: I like it but the built in Google chrome didn’t work well and it’s used for my home theater. It replaced 8 years old Pioneer receiver which was broken a few weeks back.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Lee

customer_reviews.title: Best reciever !
customer_reviews.text: Great receiver , Hdr is out of this world !
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound and easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Just wow! Sound is superb with Klipsch 5.1 theater speakers. Setup is almost completely automatic and give a full and even sound field. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bernhard Jokiel, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Sweet deal on Amazon for this receiver. Paired it with my 82" Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: M. Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Sounds nice
customer_reviews.text: I like the easy set up. And that you can see through out the settings displayed on the tv. It runs my speakers with no problems
customer_reviews.author: Travzcolt

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Upgrading from another Pioneer sans 4k/HDR support and this was a welcomed updated, great quality and sound as expected.
customer_reviews.author: vad1110

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Great receiver for the money, right now I have a configure for 7.1 with Dolby Atmos height speakers but have room to upgrade to 9.1 in the future
customer_reviews.author: Patrick rodney

customer_reviews.title: Sound good but ...
customer_reviews.text: Pioneer on screen option and setting are user not friendly
customer_reviews.author: Brian Jorgensen

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver. Sound quality is amazing and is very easy to set up. Could not be happier!
customer_reviews.text: Great receiver. Sound quality is amazing and is very easy to set up. Could not be happier!
customer_reviews.author: CCzajka

customer_reviews.title: Great sound / value
customer_reviews.text: Great value, it was a little hard to set up relative to other brands that are a little more user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great 4K picture
customer_reviews.text: Very good for your money and sounds great easy to set up and good reckons support
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: Incredible sound
customer_reviews.text: This receiver has the MCACC system which can automatically tune itself to the room; it compensates for speaker distortion, echo, speaker crossover delays and all other distortions. The resulting sound is beautiful - far beyond any other stereo receiver.
customer_reviews.author: JaytheGeek

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: I was running a Yamaha 683 in my home theater with a 5.1.2 layout. This allowed me to move to a 7.1.2 layout. I have it hooked to my LG OLED and love it. Sound quality is good and having the flexibility of 7.1.2 with dual subs is great.
customer_reviews.author: DSLR Shooter

product_meta.title: Pioneer VSX-LX303 9.2 Channel 4k UltraHD Network A/V Receiver Black
product_meta.description: Designed for optimum Dolby Atmos/DTS: x movie playback In a seamless 7. 2. 2Ch/5. 2. 4Ch surround sound calibrated by MCCAC, and with support for next-generation video standards, The Elite VSX-LX303 brings multi-dimensional excitement to your home theater and beyond With powered zone 2 and now, zone 3. Multichannel stereophonic philosophy treats discrete sounds encoded in surround formats equally through a marriage of direct energy amplification and MCCAC calibration. Key aspects of the direct energy design, such as shortened signal paths, clean grounds, and high simultaneous multi-channel power output achieve reproduction quality that's source-faithful and in perfect harmony with adjacent channels. Enjoy internet radio and network streaming services with chrome cast built-in and DTS Play-Fi via your Smartphone.
feature_bullets: Direct energy amplification at 100 W/Ch. (8 ohms, 20 Hz-20 kHz, THD 0. 08 %, 2Ch Driven, FTC)/ 200 W/Ch. (6 ohms, 1 kHz, THD 10 %, 1Ch Driven)
